Key Match Events: The Cubs' road offense was highlighted, with 24 runs scored in the series against the Dodgers.
A bases-loaded single by Pete Crow-Armstrong led to a Dodgers' mistake, tying the game.
A botched double-steal attempt in the ninth inning cost the Cubs a potential tying run.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Craig Counsell expressed frustration with baserunning mistakes and the tough loss.
Players like Cody Bellinger and Seiya Suzuki acknowledged the difficulty of the game and the need to continue fighting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs' performance on the road has been better than at Wrigley Field this season.
The team's remaining schedule is mostly against sub-.500 teams, providing a favorable path to the postseason.
